title: Rotational inertia - rod with three spheres

content.question: Three small spheres are attached to a rod of negligible mass that is parallel to the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis and free to rotate about a pivot at <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, as shown. The masses and locations of the spheres are indicated in the figure. The rotational inertia of the spheres-rod system about the pivot is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="3.5 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="5.0 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="8.5 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power kilogram meters squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
